nodes.bodyText: It would be nice if the javadoc gave examples of the types of id strings this method is expecting.

Additionally, because I can't figure out how to leave comments on unchanged lines, I think it'd be nice if distinction between "fullId" and "resourceId" was documented more clearly (with id examples) in the javadocs for getResourceId and getFullId. Maybe in the addTo methods to? How are they related and why would I use one over the other?

So the difference is really that getResourceID returns the ID to the actual resource and getFullId is the... full ID from the request.
So for a Memento, your full ID is info:fedora/object/fcr:versions/2020040110101 and your resource ID is info:fedora/object.
However for some reason nonRdfSourceDescriptions need their resource Id to contain the fcr:metadata part.
ie. Full ID : info:fedora/object/fcr:metadata/fcr:versions/2020040110101
Resource ID : info:fedora/object/fcr:metadata
I'm not sure why but I guess it has to do with how the file is stored with and read from the persistence layer.
Yeah, that was my understanding, and that was a great explanation. Something like that should be in the javadoc.
Added this to the top of the class, I hope that is okay.
Why is this needed? The getRoot static builder could just pass "" to the standard constructor.
Generally, using Objects.equals() is safer. In this case, it's probably impossible for fullId to be null?
It is impossible, but I can change it.

I can move it to the HttpIdentifierConverter if you prefer

It would be nice (in the future) if the parentId were also a FedoraID.

I wonder if we could rename this method to make it a bit clearer that this is a factory method. createRootID or getRepositoryRootID maybe? On my initial skim i was thinking this was a getter method for retrieving the "root" portion of an ID, even though its obviously a static method.
mockFedoraID and mockFedoraMementoID don't actually appear to be a mocks, might be good to remove the mock part to avoid confusion.
Yeah, I thought about that and never got back to it.

It seems possible that the parts could start/end with more than one slash. Could consolidate this into a regex to trim both ends, something like .replaceAll("(^/+|/+$)", "").
Alternatively, if you want to go into apache commons land, there is  StringUtils.strip(s, "/"):
http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/javadocs/api-release/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.html#strip-java.lang.String-java.lang.String-

I did think about that, but I was thinking that the use of array of strings would be internal to the codebase (as we normally pass in the full ID from the HTTP level). So it would be our bad code that would include multiple slashes. So not stripping them would (hopefully) catch those errors before they got to the code base. I can strip them, just wanted to outline my thought process.

A minor thing, but I'm trying to get a sense of the standard in this project for capitalization of acronyms in class names. For the most part, I am seeing camel case used, such as FedoraLdp, FedoraAcl, DefaultRdfStream. The only exception appears to be fcrepo-persistence-ocfl which has a mixture. Camel case is also used for all variable/method names in this class. I'm wondering if it might be most consistent to name the class FedoraId. Just a suggestion though.
One other thing, does the parameter need to be the fullId? It seems like we are passing the resource id in some cases.

Not really, you always have to pass in the entire ID. Now for a resource the resourceID == fullID, but if you are at the TimeMap then you HAVE to create the FedoraId with the full id (ie. object1/fcr:versions) or else the FedoraId won't know it is a timemap.

Okay, I was mainly asking about if it was the fullId because one of the addTo methods passes in the resource id, so wanted to double check if the variable name and documentation should declare it as fullId
Only strip trailing slashes if the ID

I'm wondering about the need for both addToResourceId and addToFullId. The former seems to exclusively be used for adding fcr:metadata to the end of an id at the moment. If its predictable/practical, maybe we could have one method which knows when to start from each variation of the id, rather than leaving it to the rest of the code base to reason it?
If it did end up just being addToId, it might be clearer to use language like resolve or resolveId instead. We're using that verb in many other places for specialized concatenation methods, and its also used by core java classes, like Path.
I think I understand what you are saying, but I am unclear on what you are suggesting it looks like.

this is the only usage of idBuilder(String... parts), it might make sense to merge these methods. In which case you could also skip over the intermediate array, keeping things streaming through the joining

Yes it is the external path of the request which is the same as the full id without the FEDORA_ID_PREFIX (but with a leading / added). If that is confusing I could make a private method that just strips info:fedora off the front of the fullId

Might mainly be the word "external" that's throwing me off since we use it elsewhere to describe the form of an id presented at the HTTP layer, like "http://localhost:8080/fcrepo/rest/12345". Whether it comes from a precalculated variable or a helper method is okay with me.
